subject: Re: [junit] Testing a method that outputs a text file.
msgSnippet: ... If you don t have the liberty to implement it the way Curt Sampson mentioned (with readers and writers, which I also prefer) you can test against a master
messageBody:
On Tuesday 08 June 2004 11:27 pm, John Miller wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I've got a class method that writes out a (text) file.
>
> Given a known input how can I test that the output is correct.
>
> I'm using ANT to run my test cases.

If you don't have the liberty to implement it the way Curt Sampson mentioned
(with readers and writers, which I also prefer) you can test against a master
by doing file comparison.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
